creator: olivier.bedelet@med.ge.com
text:
I log in chainsaw a message containing xml element. Chainsaw doesn't display all
xml element

chainsaw log file
-------------------------------------------------------------
<log4j:event logger="com.ge.med.it.dmwl.server.webservices.ConfigHandler"
timestamp="1089275822047" level="INFO" thread="Thread-5">
<log4j:message><![CDATA[return <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!--WARNING: Do NOT edit this file. Please use configuration software-->
<DMWL>
  <Server>
  blabla
  </Server>
</DMWL>

]]></log4j:message>
<log4j:properties><log4j:data name="hostname" value="mycomputer"/>
</log4j:properties>
</log4j:event>
-------------------------------------------------------------
This file was generated by a RollingFileAppender with a XMLLayout

but chainsaw display
-------------------------------------------------------------
Level    INFO
Logger   com.ge.med.it.dmwl.server.webservices.ConfigHandler
Time     2004-07-08 10:37:02,047
Thread   Thread-5
Message  return ?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>    blabla   
NDC      null
Class    ?
Method   ?
Line     ?
File     ?
Properties
{{hostname,file}{application,logxml.log}{log4jid,1}}
Throwable
-------------------------------------------------------------

xml element DMWL and SERVER are not displayed

Steps to Reproduce:
Loading the given chainsaw log file

Build Date & Platform:
Chainsaw version: launched chainsaw with web start from
http://logging.apache.org/log4j/docs/chainsaw.html, 8 july 2004
JVM version: 1.4.2

Thanks for reporting this.  I've made the change to the event detail layout
(escapes necessary xml characters).  It's not yet available in the web start
version - you'll need to retrieve the Chainsaw/log4j sources to try it out.  

The web start version should be updated by sometime early next week.

There is an ant script available from the 'installation' section of the Chainsaw
page which will retrieve the sources from CVS and build Chainsaw for you - see
http://logging.apache.org/log4j/docs/chainsaw.html
